subject: Self Care
title: Teaching Kids Digital Wellness
description: A fast breakdown of Teaching Kids Digital Wellness for builders.

hook.text: Steve Jobs limited his kids' screen time. Bill Gates didn't give his children phones until age 14. They knew something.

buildup.text: Children's developing brains are more susceptible to the attention-hijacking effects of screens than adult brains.

discovery.text: The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends co-viewing, time limits, and tech-free family meals as foundations.

twist.text: Banning screens entirely backfires. Teaching intentional use creates lifelong digital literacy and self-regulation.

climax.text: Model the behavior you want. Children don't listen to screen time rules. They copy what they see you doing with your phone.

punchline.text: Model digital wellness. Kids copy what you do, not what you say.

quiz.question: What is the most effective way to teach children digital wellness?
